newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Foreign buying boosts Slovenian shares.
newsitem.headline: Foreign buying boosts Slovenian shares.

text.p: Slovenian shares firmed 1.73 percent on Monday on the back of continued foreign demand for shares of newly privatised firms.
"Foreign investors, mostly Austrian banks, are currently designing prices on our market and if they continue buying Kolinska and Lek, the SBI index could exceed 1,000 soon," one broker said.
* The seven-share SBI index rose 16.05 points to 941.77.
* 13 shares rose and four fell, while seven were untraded.
* Turnover fell to 137.7 million tolars from 153.9 million.
* Newly privatised shares of pharmaceutical producer Lek were the most actively traded, firming 2.38 percent to 15,359 tolars on volume of 5,332 shares for total turnover of 81.9 million tolars.
* Financial consultancy Finmedia was the biggest gainer, firming 4.11 percent to 16,855 tolars on volume of 171 shares for total turnover of 2.8 million tolars.

* Construction company GPG was the leading decliner, caving in 9.09 percent to 6,855 tolars on volume of 24 shares for total turnover of 165,000 tolars. -- Novica Mihajlovic, Ljubljana newsroom, 386-61-125-8439
